instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> came in dead
 draws 5V found <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 6v...
i changed <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the system draws 20V 0.00A 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.31V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> is 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> not present 
Want to try DFU but not entering DFU and T2 is warming up HELP!!.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
T2 overheats?
Check voltage on the small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
T2 heats up to 38Â°c on thermal camera normal..
L7811-P0V8SLPDDR_SW0 is pulsing from 0V to 0.834V
L7806-PVDDCPUAWAKE_SW0 is pulsing from 0V to 0.758V
L7816-P0V9SLPDDR_SW0 is pulsing from 0V to 0.9V
L7814-P1V1SLPS2R_SW0 is pulsing from 0V to 1.1V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
SLPS2R voltages must be stable.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> pulsing too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils.
Don't forget L9080/580.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message: Did you check the other SSD side (L9580)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
I mentioned the plural.
Can't you find other LDO lines of <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
I can only find two LDO'S
 <SIGNAL>LDO_RTC</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LDO_CORE</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A DEAD
threads.message:
All small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> are pulsing?
None of them has stable voltage?
You may have T2 internal damage.
